comprehensive_overview: NGS (Next-Generation Sequencing) refers to high-throughput sequencing technologies that allow for rapid and cost-effective sequencing of DNA and RNA. NGS has revolutionized genomics research, enabling various applications in areas such as genetics, personalized medicine, and evolutionary biology.
core_features: NGS platforms offer high sequencing throughput, high accuracy, scalability for different project sizes, and the ability to detect genomic variations, gene expression levels, and epigenetic modifications.
